law.catch_line: Execution of new bond for defective one.
law.text: If a bond provided for by any statute derived from the former Civil Code, or by the Rules of Civil Procedure be adjudged to be defective, a new and sufficient one may be executed in such reasonable time as the court may fix, with the same effect as if originally executed.
law.history: Transferred 1952 Ky. Acts ch. 84, sec. 1, effective July 1, 1953, from C.C. sec. 682.
